A:9
V:8

:)

Changing your DNS will have no effect on the legal notices. All DNS does is it converts a domain name into an ip address, such as thepiratebay.org -> 194.71.107.15

This will only have an effect if an ISP is blocking thepiratebay on their DNS (which is the most common way to block a torrent site).

It will NOT stop a monitoring bot from finding your ip in a torrent swarm, nor will it magically somehow stop your ISP from pulling the plug on your internet.

With that said, OpenDNS (which are the servers the above post mentioned) are worth checking out for other reasons (although you need local servers or your browsing speed may suffer).

You might want to look at an IP blocklist that tries to block the monitoring bots (it's not %100 effective but university studies have shown a massive improvement when using them)
